text: the the the major principles or the
major tenants of our company were in
place day one so the reason I I focused
on this industry I saw a big future for
the automotive business in China now
keep in mind in 19 92 93 when I started
this you know China was doing about a
million Vehicles a
year a lot of people were excited about
what China might become but there were
ALS for every person that was excited
there were at least two or three
Skeptics and they said China can never
develop into a large Auto industry but
it just seemed to me that China's almost
the same size United States in terms of
area geographical area and I felt that
if you were in the camp as I was in
1992 and you believe that China was
going to continue to grow economically
as day follows night it had to follow
the China have a big Auto industry
because how else do you get people and
goods around a country that size without
the um you know the highways and a lot
of trucks buses and pass so I I became a
big believer in the Auto industry and I
knew it'd get big it took a little bit
longer than I thought but I'd say it's
gotten bigger than I even imagined back
then but I but I knew it was going to be
large you know one of the largest in the
in the world within a relatively short
period of time the component sector was
interesting because the big assemblers
were coming into China but they had
trouble dragging their suppliers in so
there was a vacuum and then the other
piece that I said I'm not going to do
anything in China unless we have
majority ownership and the reason for
that was that I felt that it wasn't
enough to create a good company in China
we had to create a company was globally
competitive and that meant that whatever
I found in China no matter how good it
might be it had to change so I had to be
in a position to change so that all came
together in the beginning of 93 because
the government passed a policy that said
that they were trying to encourage
investment in components and so they
said that foreign investors in
components could have majority so by the
beginning of 1993 it all kind of lined
up I like the industry there's a vacuum
in the there was a vacuum in the
component sector and the government said
I could have majority and so those and
and the principles was we were going to
take a group of existing companies in
China that had strong Market positions
we're going to put them together into
one company
it'll be much stronger because it had a
wider product range we're going to bring
in we're going to develop management
we're going to make these globally
competitive companies so we're going to
not only become a big factor in the
China Market but we're also going to be
competitive globally I mean those and it
was all going to be it was all going to
revolve around our ability to really
develop those management teams so those
principles were right there from the
very beginning they're still in
existence today none of that's changed
obviously the tactics of how we did all
that has changed over the years as we've
confronted difficulties or or seen new
opportunities but those basic tenants
basic you were still there
